She’s losing it. She’s only seeing her goal and is willing to shed far more blood than she has to. I don’t like what she’s becoming, frankly. I haven’t for a while now.

But it’s far more advanced as the season is closing.

I’m still cringing over the fact Jaimie went back to Cersei. I know Tyrion sent him with a plan, but that last scene with Brienne told me he was still hung up on her. But I still hold on to the hope he went there to end it.

I’m still thinking about the prophecy, so…

I liked the beginning of the attack. It was great seeing the Hound finally fighting his brother. And I’m also glad Arya chose to flee and live. She also has to know when it’s time to run.

And of course, Dany lost it and attacked even though they rang the bells. Great, so I was right. Mad king mode it is. Thanks for that useless circle.

I was also very disappointed with how Cersei was killed. Where is the prophecy ? Did they consider Jaimie failing to find an exit was him killing her ? Because otherwise, I don’t see it.

She was like the final antagonist of that show. And they took her out with a building collapsing on her ? Well, I expected more frankly.

Also, I feared for Arya a bunch of times, but I’m glad her plot armour is still going strong enough. But boy, it reminded me of that time she was chased down by the waif. She had it hard again.

8x06 - I really liked that conversation Jon had with Tyrion. Like he knows deep down what she did wasn’t right at all, but he still loves her so much he’s conflicted.

Don’t be dumb, Jon. She’s went down the bad road and you know it.

I loved how they played it even if I wished they never went there in the first place. But since they did, I liked the last interaction they had and how you can slowly see Jon trying to convince her, only to understand more and more how far she is into this.

And then he killed her.

The fact Tyrion was forced into being the hand of Bran, chosen king of the seven kingdoms baffles me. I mean, imo, he barely helped and I couldn’t care for his Three Eyed Raven thing, because most of the time, he just seemed MIA.

But well, why not ? I’m not feeling this ending already anyway.

Also, Jon Snow being sentenced to be in the Night’s Watch felt very coming into circles again. What’s the point ?

But Arya going to West of Westeros like she said she would was very satisfying. At least, she got a good ending. I’m still salty about all the rest, but I’m glad my favourite came out the good way.

(It might have felt a bit easy but I’ll take it)

The little counsel reunion in the end made me scoff. It was silly and stupid. Those dorks are never gonna work properly together without bickering ha ha.

Sansa being crowned Queen in the North. Yeah why not, it’s not like there’s anyone else. But she didn’t do much, imo.

I didn’t really dislike that season. But it didn’t feel like a real ending. I feel they could have cut some things and do so much more. I don’t know if it’s because it’s a big show, but I expected more.

Well, anyway, goodbye Game of Thrones. It was still a nice ride.
trail.content:
Okay, so I’ll do this review a little differently for the last season. I will review each episode.

8x01 - So the first one was a bit uneventful regarding the threat and all, but it was very much needed in terms of reunions.

I loved how Arya was in the crowd at first and how her face changed upon seeing her brother, then the hound, then Gendry. Ha ha. I laughed because I totally forgot she had not only one reunion to have but three.

Sansa and Daenerys bickering was fun. Especially since Dany’s harsh comments to Sansa made my day. I don’t like Dany much anymore, but still better than Sansa.

No offence to those who do like her, of course.

Her comment about dragon eating anything was savage ha ha.

I didn’t like that Lyana was pulling away from Jon because he left. But I admit he’s not so good at explaining. Although I think he experienced too much disbelief by that point to ever consider displaying the full story.

Arya meeting with the hound and giving him a death glare and all was priceless. I loved how he complimented and insulted her at the same time ha ha. And she was definitely flirting with Gendry.

I didn’t really think about this ship before, but it could be cute.

Can’t wait for him and Jon to see how badass she really is though.

And of course, that reunion with Jon was utterly adorable. Her chuckling and throwing herself into his arms, running so she could be hugging him faster. And how he saw she still had needle.

It was adorable how she defended Sansa. And I loved their hug and joy to see each other again. I couldn’t help but notice the way Arya flinched when he asked if she used needle.

I bet she’s worried about what he’s gonna think if he learns the truth. Him more than others.

I couldn’t care less about Cersei and her fucking Euron.

But Yara headbutting her brother for leaving her to potentially die felt great. I hope this is finally the time for him to grow a pair (pun kinda intended, sorry).

Jon and Dany. I don’t mind but I don’t care much yet. But that scene with Jon flying was great and a bit funny. Him panicking was so precious ha ha.

The moment where Dany goes to thank Sam for saving Jorah, I was smiling like a dork. I loved how she praised him and all, but when it turned out she burnt his father and brother.

I totally forgot about that, tbh. It was rough. She wanted to thank him but it went awry. And that urged him to reveal the truth to Jon.

Well, he asked Bran to do it and Bran said he was not Bran again so he had to. I’m mocking a bit because so far Bran has been staring at people from afar and it has been like that for a while. It’s kind of funny.

The reveal was great frankly. Jon being distraught over it and Sam being hurt so he’s trying to convince him to take the throne for himself. Ugh. All the emotions. I laughed though that he got everything in the end, BUT the fact he slept with his aunt.

Can’t wait for what’s next. Oh and I was very happy to see Tormund survive. (The “he’s got blue eyes” moment killed me. Those morons, ha ha). And many interactions were interesting.

Sansa and Tyrion meeting again too. Many possibilities with everyone in the same place. I’m intrigued for the possible pairings. (And I wanna see Arya and Jon fight together frankly).

We could have had something great from Bran and Jaimie, but of course, he doesn’t care since he’s the Three Eyed Raven now. I’m sorry, i have to roll my eyes at this a bit.

8x02 - Okay, so there is not so much to say about the second episode either, because of course they cut it right before we dive into the big battle. I’m waiting to see what’s next btw, because, even though now the following episode is out, BF and I are planning to buy a new TV with OLED technology, if you know about it.

And yeah… I want some dragons in big HD ! So i’m willing to wait.

Jaime finally coming to Winterfell was great, because I was thrilled last season when he finally left Cersei’s ass. It was about time frankly ! But we got another chapter of Bran staring at people and saying uncomfortable things once more ha ha.

I couldn’t help but laugh at that “things we do for love”. Jaime must have thought he was trying to make him feel guilty, when really, he doesn’t give two shits about it. Bran is not Bran anymore, he’ll say it again.

I loved Arya and Gendry scenes this episode. I didn’t ship it before, but i kind like the idea and mostly, Gendry being all flustered and going to make the weapon right away after Arya showed him her throwing skills.

God, i love her so much. Seeing her having a sex scene for once was weird, but mostly because it’s never been Arya’s purpose. Aside from that, I didn’t mind it. She’s all grown up.

And also, I loved how she interrogated him, assassin’s style, and then was so bossy. I also love how he was looking at her with such adoration. Yeah, a total badass loves you.

Also, thank god Tormund came back ! I couldn’t help but burst into laughing though when he mentioned Brienne and I remembered he had a tremendous crush about her ha ha.

Sorry, but I think she has one on Jaime, not you.

I also love to see the dynamic between the two Lannister’s brothers back. I loved that Tyrion wasn’t afraid to speak up to him and tell him that he did knew who Cersei was. He was just too infatuated at the time to even think about leaving her.

Also, i always was fond of the idea of Brienne and Jaime, so seeing him making her a knight had me all kinds of emotional. It was so adorable frankly and everyone chanting and her being so touched. Ugh. Kill me now. They’re cute too.

I probably rolled my eyes at Dany though. Could you please stop spitting on your Hand ? I mean okay, he makes mistakes, but so do you ! And frankly, she’s annoying me most of the time now.

Also, I don’t care for her and Jon being together, so there must be that. I don’t like how she’s answering to his revelation. I’m not sure this is gonna end well, and mostly, she never even offered for them to take the throne together.

I think, even though I don’t care for their relationship, that it could be a great balance somehow. Because Jon is too soft and she’s too harsh sometimes. So both on the throne ? I don’t see why not.

Also, I bet she’s gonna be mistrustful of him, even though he confessed everything when he could have easily avoid it. He barely gave himself time to think about it before telling her, so… I feel i’m gonna roll my eyes often. Can we please skip to big battles instead ?

BUT. Dany and Sansa trying to bond for Jon and ending up being even more at odds made me laugh so hard. I just can’t, it’s ridiculous ha ha.

I loved seeing Gilly again and how she convinced that kid to go to the crypts to be safe was super sweet really.

I also love how Sam stood up for himself and told them off about killing a white walker and protecting Gilly and all. And the comment on him stealing a bunch of books. Ha ha. I love you adorable dork who evolved, no matter what people are saying, you’re a gem.

Honourable mention to that replica by the end though “I was sleeping with my sister and you had one friend in the world who was sleeping with his sister”. Ha ha. It killed me.

Sam giving his family sword to Jorah was inevitable and felt right somehow.

And now, we’re diving into the biggest battle ever ! I can’t wait to come back from my trip to buy that big ass TV and watch this in awe. Also, it’s weird to think there is only four episodes left.

8x03 - Okay so, obviously I liked the battle very much. It was really beautiful to see with my new TV, I don’t regret waiting.

But, I have to admit, I was a bit surprised it ended in an episode. So much that I kept waiting for the deads to attack again until the season finale. It never happened, so I wonder why they made such a fuzz for seasons only to resolve this in an hour and a half ?

I guess I never thought the final boss of GOT would be Cersei. Sure, she was one of the last problems, but I didn’t think she would be it.

Anyway, it was still a rough battle with many casualties. And even the ones in the crypt got a little action (I think I yelled at Sansa to use that freaking knife, but she ended up safe anyway. I swear, she could at least try a bit. She barely got it out).

I was scared shitless for Arya a bunch of times. But how great was that she was battling fiercely when older ones stayed hidden ? But the minute the hound sees her, he goes after her to save her.

I love their dynamic frankly. Weirdest brotp but I dig it.

I loved those references at old Arya  quotes that they made. And how she went to attack the Night King. When he caught her by the throat, I was worried. I thought her dropping the knife was because she was being strangled.

But then she took it back lower and got him right in the guts. I was cheering like hell. Damn, my girl, you looked hella cool.

I mean, Arya Stark is the one who put an end to all this. I’m just so proud of her. God.

8x04 - Arya Stark, hero of Winterfell. It has a great ring to it.

How cute was lovestruck Gendry, searching for Arya ? I was glad Dany told him he was now a lord. But when he went to see Arya and started declaring his love and asking her to be his lady…

I knew she was gonna turn him down. And I’m glad they went down that route, because it is true to Arya, imo. She was never a lady. It was not her purpose. So, of course, she loves Gendry.

But she’s not gonna change who she is because of him. And I love it.

Brienne, Jaimie and Tyrion in a drinking game felt like the beginning of a joke ha ha. But I was a bit sad when she fled after the statement about her being a virgin.

Still, it was nice to see Jaimie and her finally acting on that attraction. But I couldn’t help but want to hug Tormund who finally understood he had no chance with her. Ha ha. Poor guy, finally seeing the truth.

I didn’t care much for Sansa’s scene with the hound. But it’s still an interesting enough dynamic somehow.

Dany and Jon fighting over whether Jon could tell his secret to his sisters had me rolling my eyes a bit. I mean, you know Jon is not gonna be able to keep anything from Arya.

Sansa, sure. But Arya ? That girl got skills, she would absolutely figure out something’s up at least.

But it annoyed me even more to see Sansa being so reluctant to swear before being told. Okay, you’re distrustful of Dany, and I also get why. But, if Jon is asking, why keep fighting it ?

I was glad Arya promised first though. You know she loves and trusts Jon so much. And she still voiced her concerns to him, which is good.

I loved that moment of brotp between Tormund and Jon.

And also, Jon and Sam. They actually said they were best friends. That’s so stupidly adorable. And I was thrilled to see Sam and Gilly having a child.

“If it’s a boy, we want to name him Jon” “I hope it’s a girl”. Ha ha.

Also, Arya and the Hound heading to King’s Landing together. Yeah, we all know what unfinished business you mean Arya. Wouldn’t that have to do with a certain list ?

(Bronn threatening Tyrion and Jaimie was funny enough.)

But boy, that secret didn’t take long to spread ha ha. Okay, maybe telling Jon in the first place was a bad idea. I don’t feel he’s good at keeping those.

But it was only logical it would get out this fast.

And it is true Dany has been taking unnecessary measures for quite a while now.

I was totally down for them marrying and ruling together, even though I don’t care about the ship in itself. But I felt it was a perfect middle ground.

Only I knew Dany would never admit such a thing. She’s been wanting that throne for quite a while, and she has done terrible things to get to it (let’s not kid ourselves, she wasn’t always in her right and compassionate mind). Why would she want to share ?

I was a bit salty they never tried to talk to her about the option though.

And of course, Cersei had to be a cunt and kill Missandei. I knew she was a goner, but still was sad to see her die.

8x05 - Seeing Daenerys, not eating, not leaving her chambers, and feeling like Jon betrayed her by telling his secret was a bit annoying.

I feel she’s descending into mad king mode, and it’s a shame frankly. Because we’ve been told for seasons (by none other than her) that she’s not her father. And to state such a thing for so long, only to have her prove everybody else right in the end ? It’s really sad and it feels like it was all for nothing.

And of course, Dany lost it and attacked even though they rang the bells. Great, so I was right. Mad king mode it is. Thanks for that useless circle.

I was also very disappointed with how Cersei was killed. Where is the prophecy ? Did they consider Jaimie failing to find an exit was him killing her ? Because otherwise, I don’t see it.

She was like the final antagonist of that show. And they took her out with a building collapsing on her ? Well, I expected more frankly.

Also, I feared for Arya a bunch of times, but I’m glad her plot armour is still going strong enough. But boy, it reminded me of that time she was chased down by the waif. She had it hard again.

I loved how they played it even if I wished they never went there in the first place. But since they did, I liked the last interaction they had and how you can slowly see Jon trying to convince her, only to understand more and more how far she is into this.
